result.execSummary:
The defendant Shamul B Pitts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and DNA To be paid from prison wages.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: Detainer Cancellation
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shamul B Pitts in court, in custody, with attorney Daniel P. Murray.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  State makes sentencing arguments.  Defense makes sentencing arguments.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

6 MONTHS JAIL - CONCURRENT 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid from prison wages);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid from prison wages );
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

DRGOD:  $10.00 (to be paid from prison wages).
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
filed, to be produced from Kettle Moraine Correctional Inst.

Attorney Murray advises parties have reached a resolution and requests date for plea and sentencing.  Defendant to be produced for next hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on February 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on February 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.
